broadwick.data.readers

Class DataFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.data.readers.DataFileReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchedMovementsFileReader, DirectedMovementsFileReader, FullMovementsFileReader, LocationsFileReader, PopulationsFileReader, TestsFileReader

    public abstract class DataFileReader
extends Object
    Base class for all data file readers, containing useful common functionality..

      protected String asCsv(Collection<String> data)
      Convert a collection of elements read from the data file (the column names in the internal database) into a CSV string.

      Create or append to a string command in the form "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS [table] ([col1], [col2], ..., [coln]) values (?,?,...,?)" from the details read from the configuration file.

    • Method Detail

      • asCsv

        protected final String asCsv(Collection<String> data)
        Convert a collection of elements read from the data file (the column names in the internal database) into a CSV string.
        Parameters:
        data - the collection of column names.
        Returns:
        a csv string of the input data.

      • asQuestionCsv

        protected final String asQuestionCsv(Collection<String> data)
        Convert a collection of elements read from the data file (the column names in the internal database) into a CSV string of question marks.
        Parameters:
        data - the collection of column names.
        Returns:
        as csv string of the question marks containing the same number of data elements.

      • updateCreateTableCommand

        protected final String updateCreateTableCommand(String columnName,
                                                Integer columnIndex,
                                                String columnType,
                                                Map<String,Integer> insertedColDetails,
                                                StringBuilder createTableCommand,
                                                String tableName,
                                                String sectionName,
                                                StringBuilder errors)
        Create or append to a string command in the form "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS [table] ([col1], [col2], ..., [coln]) values (?,?,...,?)" from the details read from the configuration file. 
         updateCreateTableCommand(ID, 1, " VARCHAR(128), ", new HashMap(), createTableCommand,
 TABLE_NAME, SECTION_NAME, errors);
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the column in the table
        columnIndex - the location in the csv file where it appears.
        columnType - the type of column e.g. "INT", "VARCHAR(128) NOT NULL" etc.
        insertedColDetails - a map containing the name of the column and the location in the csv file where it appears i.e. columnName, columnIndex.
        createTableCommand - a StringBuilder object that we append to to create the create table command.
        tableName - the name of the table that is being created.
        sectionName - the name of the section in the configuration file that configures the data.
        errors - a stringbuilder object to which we will append error messages.
        Returns:
        the name of the column added.

      • createTable

        protected final void createTable(String tableName,
                                 String createTableCommand,
                                 Connection connection)
                          throws SQLException
        Execute a command to create a table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to be created.
        createTableCommand - the command to create the table.
        connection - the database connection to use to create the table.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a SQL error has been encountered.

      • insert

        protected final int insert(Connection connection,
                           String tableName,
                           String insertString,
                           String dataFile,
                           String dateFormat,
                           Map<String,Integer> insertedColInfo,
                           Collection<Integer> dateFields)
        Perform the insertion into the database.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to the database.
        tableName - the name of the table into which the data will be put.
        insertString - the command used to insert a row into the database.
        dataFile - the [CSV] file that contained the data.
        dateFormat - the format of the date in the file.
        insertedColInfo - a map of column name to column in the data file.
        dateFields - a collection of columns in the csv file that contains date fields.
        Returns:
        the number of rows inserted.

      • insert

        public abstract int insert()
        Insert the data from the input file into the database. The data structure has been read and the database set up already so this method simply reads the file and extracts the relevant information, storing it in the database.
        Returns:
        the number of rows read
